results.title: Depart de Grandes Vacances
results.brief_description: A sequel to “La Famille Marin” a language training film in which the sound track records conversations and commentary is simple French Everyday expressions and simple vocabulary are used throughout the film. The Martin family is shown preparing to do on a holiday. The various members are seen packing with greater or less success. The luggage is safely stowed with one omission - the luncheon basket is left behind, unnoticed on the pavement. The misadventures of the family are followed throughout their holiday excursion.

results.title: Sportshort. No. 2. Denis Compton
results.creator_credit: Douglas Rankin, Adrian Reid and Exclusive Films
results.brief_description: A record of the life and accomplishments of Denis Compton, one of the greatest figures in English sporting history. In addition to showing his cricket strokes and some of his memorable performances at the wicket, the film illustrates his training methods and also his ability in other sports, including soccer, golf, and tennis.

results.title: Denmark
results.brief_description: Denmark yesterday and today. After giving an idea of the appearance of Denmark the film outlines its history, showing burial mounds of the Bronze Age, and the appearance of churches and other buildings at different times. Also includes footage of the industries, sports and social services of Denmark today; views of Copenhagen; and the coronation of King Frederick.

results.title: Denmark: [Paul Henningsen]
results.brief_description: A visual interpretation of the pattern and tempo of life in Denmark. Observes fishermen hauling in the catch; loading and unloading of cargo at the dock; farmers bringing their products to market and lighter side of life - holiday making and fun at the local carnival.

results.title: A Demonstration of basic film techniques
results.brief_description: Designed to serve as a practical aid for teachers presenting a course in film appreciation. Experience has shown that one of the first barriers to be broken down in such a course is the students’ ignorance of the fact that a film is MADE, that it is the result of conscious decision by the film maker. Teachers may use it to demonstrate the more common shots in film making. They may use it to establish the idea of film editing - the joining together of separate shots into a meaningful unit. The film’s deficiencies and faults should serve as valuable teaching points during discussion after the film.

results.title: Demonstration in perception
results.creator_credit: United States. Dept. of the Navy
results.brief_description: Presents some of the demonstrations in use at Princeton University, USA, for research in perception. Apparatus employed in the demonstrations includes: three chairs; size, brightness apparatus; overlay table; stationary trapezoid; rotation trapezoid; distorted rooms.

results.title: Demon and marvels
results.creator_credit: Bertrand Langlois, Gaston Sarault, Pierre Moretti and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This film depicts a world where space is geometric, noise is absent and nothing happens until a small white cube comes bumping along, stirring up movement where before there was none. Chased by a wicked demon, the cube symbolizes the inner struggle which goes on inside each one of us: the confrontation, or evasion, of one’s private demons. A film without commentary. (Awards: San Francisco)

results.title: Democracy: your voice can be heard
results.brief_description: Illustrates the effectiveness of an individual in democracy by re-creating the true story of a campaign by Detroit students for improvements at a public hospital. Their involvement provides an example of the successful advancement of a cause.

results.title: Democracy: the role of dissent
results.brief_description: A democracy has legal channels for the redress of grievances. If these seem to fail, are other actions justified? A group of tenants are faced with this question as they demonstrate and consider a rent strike in protest against the living conditions in their apartment building.

results.title: The Demanding sea
results.brief_description: A record of life at sea. Two old sailors discuss their lives against a background of moving ships - frigates, tramps, liners, tankers, trawlers and tugs - and the sea, in all its moods, benign, stormy and ice-bound. Conveys an awareness of what the sea means.
